before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"8i3ar","text":"Read background information, MIOP and BePOP-OBON information under the \"Guidelines\" tab.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

100674.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9esao","text":"Line counter with lab diapers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63dpr","text":"For extra cleanliness, you can place an autoclave or otherwise plastic bin on one side of the pump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9f2f0","text":"Place the waste flask or container on the other side of the pump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"440d7","text":"Then place a full sample bottle in the autoclave bin; however, do not remove the cap of the bottle yet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pnbu","text":"Pass the tubing through the peristaltic pump so that the luer end of the tubing is in the waste collection container. The luer end may need to be held in place by draping it through a clamp but do not pinch the tube with clamp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5l8gr","text":"Using tweezers, remove the cotton from a sterile 25 ml pipette, and attach the pipette to the other end of the tubing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9rh6","text":"To begin filtering seawater, invert bottle several times to mix sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ufm","text":"Open the bottle and insert the pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rppv","text":"Turn on the pump and set the flow speed to 1, if use old Cole-Parmer peristaltic pump, or 40-50 if using newer Cole-Parmer peristaltic pumps. Watch to ensure that water is being pumped in the proper direction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2teus","text":"If your filtration station in the direct sunlight, it is recommended to cover or drape the sample bottles with a dark bag while filtering. Alternatively, it is also possible to tape a dark garbage bag up on window to prevent direct sun exposure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ksmm","text":"Rinse the tubing: Allow ~100 ml of water to pass through the entire tubing. If you fill a 2 L polycarbonate bottle, and can just rinse down to the 2 L mark and then turn off the pump.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79qqn","text":"Attach filters: Turn off the pump. Attach a Sterivex filter to the male luer fitting at the end of the tubing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0c1r","text":"Turn back on pump and continue filtering until no water is left in the bottles. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aderv","text":"If the filter(s) clogs prior to complete sample filtration, stop pump and change necessary filter, labeling the first filter as “Filter A” and recording the filtered 3 volume and storing as described below, before attaching a new filter and resuming filtration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4d5td","text":"To store the sterivex filters, first expel any remaining water with a 30-60 ml syringe. Alternatively, you can shake the sterivex filter, forcing excess water out of the inlet (this is what colleen tends to do…wastes less plastic).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fc4gj","text":"Seal the bottom of the Sterivex filter with Parafilm. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"726lf","text":"Using a new pipette tip each time you add anything to the sterivex, add 1.8ml (2 shots of 900 μl) sucrose lysis buffer (SLB) to the Sterivex filter, keeping ~ 200 μl of space in the filter for later addition of reagents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dho8b","text":"Be sure to switch the pipet tip between each addition of 900 μl of SLB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kequ","text":"Then, seal the top of the Sterivex filter with a small piece of Parafilm or luer lock cap, and label the filters with the date and sample identification [alternatively, you can label the filters before beginning filtration to avoid getting them mixed up if filtering more sample at a time]. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv5nc","text":"Be sure to record the amount of sample filtered on the filter and/or in a field notebook. Depending on equipment available, freeze on dry ice, in liquid nitrogen or at -80°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3hbcd","text":"Store -80°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6h8jg","text":"Do not disassemble tube filter units before cleaning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5q4hr","text":"Insert the 25 ml pipette into a flask containing 2% HCl, and switch on the pump. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9c2ds","text":"We tend to rinse 4 sample tubing units at one time with about 1-2 L of 2% HCL total (so each tubing unit gets about 250-500 mL of acid washed through it).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"l8l7","text":"After the HCl wash, rinse the each tubing with 500 mL or more [autoclaved] MilliQ water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9gdi","text":"Excess water can be removed by whipping around tubing (best done outside). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkgj0","text":"Allow tubing set-up to dry before re-autoclaving.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"en2b3","text":"Sample collection bottles should be similarly rinsed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dl40","text":"Add ~100 mL 2% HCl to sample bottle, shake well, pour off HCl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kf34","text":"HCl can be used 3x before disposal, so save what you pour off for another round of bottle washing at a subsequent date (or transfer from bottle to bottle and use the same HCl to rinse 3 bottles). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7b6oe","text":"Add ~100-200 mL of autoclaved MilliQ water, or otherwise sterile water, and shake shake shake. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d9qs","text":"Pour off.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3c5jn","text":"Repeat water rinse one more time to make sure all acid is removed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7g6g5","text":"Leave bottles uncapped on counter and allow to dry completely before closing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"236ul","text":"This drying process will take \u003e1 day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1di51","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8p479","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5qm5l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6doj8","text":"Materials:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qv6u","text":"Peristaltic pump with attached pump heads","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ubeq","text":"Tubing setup: autoclaved tubing with attached male luer connection","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbnd8","text":"Sterivex filters (1 per DNA sample, 1 per RNA sample)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ep00i","text":"0.2 μm filtered Sucrose Lysis Buffer (SLB; 1.8 mL per DNA sample)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vgr2","text":"Bench covers (“diapers”)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l8kb","text":"Sterile 25 mL pipets","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ds7j","text":"Forceps","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bc25","text":"2 L bottle (1 per water sample collected, so if both DNA and RNA samples are collected then this would require 2 bottles)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ep5b","text":"P1000 pipet","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvkqs","text":"Sterile or autoclaved pipet tips for P1000 pipet","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d246u","text":"Parafilm, cut into squares","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2br34","text":"Sterivex luer lock caps","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ankj4","text":"Gloves","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50s7p","text":"Squirt bottle with 70% ethanol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1fuk","text":"Sharpies, Lab Markers and Pencils","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4d6pj","text":"Shop towels","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bo4em","text":"Cooler (to keep samples in after collection)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cn2la","text":"Labels","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t518","text":"2% HCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9isjs","text":"MilliQ water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au8m4","text":"Dry ice or liquid nitrogen","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5g42e","text":"Kim wipes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bise6","text":"Repair kit","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"a06li","text":"Important: To prevent biofilm formation between sampling trips, all filtration","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"85ih6","text":"equipment must be rinsed with dilute HCl and deionized water immediately after use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3lh0c","text":"Before starting, ensure to have sucrose lysis buffer prepared.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dv7m1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1mo7t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":[{"affiliation":"Hakai Institute","affiliation_url":null,"image":{"placeholder":"/img/avatars/016.png","source":"/img/avatars/016.png","webp_source":""},"is_verified_user":null,"link":null,"name":"Colleen Kellogg","note":"","username":"colleen-kellogg"}],"created_at":1716825113,"creator":{"name":"Andreas Novotny","username":"andreas-novotny1"},"doi":"dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.j8nlk8op1l5r/v1","doi_status":1,"fork_id":0,"guid":"09BBA6B21C4111EFA15F0A58A9FEAC02","has_subprotocols":0,"id":100673,"image":{"placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qm8mcbk77.png","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qm8mcbk77.png","webp_placeholder":"","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qnkccbk77.webp"},"is_unlisted":false,"load_collapsed":true,"public":true,"stats":null,"title":"Sucrose lysis buffer","title_html":"Sucrose lysis buffer","type_id":1,"uri":"sucrose-lysis-buffer-dei93ch6","version_data":{"code":"dei93ch6","has_approved_merge_request":false,"has_pending_merge_request":false,"id":0,"is_parent_public":false,"is_same_owner":false,"merge_request":null,"parent_id":null,"parent_uri":null,"version_class":100673}}}}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5nr7g","text":"This protocol is used to extract genomic DNA from 0.22μm sterivex filters using Quiagens Blood and Tissue Kit. The protocol was developed as an equivalent replacement for the Phenol Chloroform extraction protocol. This protocol is developed to work across all domains of life, from viruses to prokaryotes to eukaryotes, allowing for both amplicon sequencing and shotgun sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7lj0e","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"470qq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ppdm","text":"BACKGROUND

This protocol is used to extract genomic DNA from 0.22μl sterivex filters using a modified version of the    .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":119,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4kdon","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76tsi","text":"This protocol was developed as an equivavelt to the Phenol Chloroform protocol for newly started projects that does not require comparable results to the weekly sampling series.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ldbe","text":"
Spatial coverage and environments of relevance
As part of the Hakai Institute Ocean Observing Program, biomolecular samples have been collected weekly, from 0 to near bottom (260 m), to genetically characterize plankton communities in the Northern Salish Sea since 2015, developing a climatology from which we can begin uncover the physical, chemical and biological drivers of community and functional change in the dynamic coastal waters of coastal British Columbia. This protocol is developed to work across all domains of life, from viruses to prokaryotes to eukaryotes, allowing for both amplicon sequencing and shotgun sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":46},{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c217j","text":"
Personnel Required
 1 Technician
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9olf","text":"Safety
Identify hazards associated with the procedure and specify protective equipment and safety training required to safely execute the procedure!
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e86ou","text":"Training requirements
Sterile technique, pipetting skills. Work-safe laboratory practices.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85rjm","text":"Time needed to execute the procedure","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":36},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o6ph","text":"1 Day (for 24 samples).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","10_0":"","10_1":"","11_0":"","11_1":"","12_0":"","12_1":"","13_0":"","13_1":"","14_0":"","14_1":"","15_0":"","15_1":"","16_0":"","16_1":"","17_0":"","17_1":"","18_0":"","18_1":"","19_0":"","19_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","20_0":"","20_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","7_0":"","7_1":"","8_0":"","8_1":"","9_0":"","9_1":""},"colTitles":["MIOP parent_protocols.title: Subsampling Ethanol Preservative from Zooplankton Museum Collections for DNA Extractions

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"1mo49","text":"This protocol is modified based on the manual of:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21to","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f57sk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9gnhu","text":"We are aiming to do about 24 samples per day, but you can aim for less than that until you get comfortable with the protocol.","type":"unstyled"}],"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","entityMap":{},"guid":"4104C6D4341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"QIAgen DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit, 50 rxn","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"69504","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/shop/sample-technologies/dna-sample-technologies/genomic-dna/dneasy-blood-and-tissue-kit?cmpid=QVenSPP1404quartzySC","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/","name":"Qiagen"}}}}}

related_materials.name: QIAgen DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit, 50 rxn

entries.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2sesr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn88u","text":"This protocol assumes that samples have been collected and preserved according to this procedure:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":97},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":97}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ta75","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ct8ga","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":100674,"title":"Seawater Filtration for Microbial or Environmental DNA","title_html":"Seawater Filtration for Microbial or Environmental DNA","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"seawater-filtration-for-microbial-or-environmental-deja3cie","image":{"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qnfucbk77.jpg","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qnfucbk77.jpg","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Andreas Novotny","affiliation":"University of British Columbia","affiliation_url":"ubc.ca","username":"andreas-novotny1","link":"https://linktr.ee/andreasnovotny","image":{"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qnxpcbk77.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qnxpcbk77.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qnxncbk77.webp"}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":21},"type_id":1,"guid":"609A364F1C4211EFA15F0A58A9FEAC02"}}}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"apdju","text":"Set aside ATL buffer, AL buffer, proteinase K, RNase A and anhydrous ethanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahilb","text":"Put the ATL and AL buffers in the incubator to eliminate any precipitate that may be in the solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":101}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpnu6","text":"There is a cardboard box in the mini freezer with pro K aliquots. Each aliquot has enough volume for 12 samples. The anhydrous ethanol is stored in the CR1 mini fridge, and in the CR2 in the mini freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"42g7t","text":"Calculate the volume of each reagent you will need for each step and have a one-time-use tube to make an aliquot for that specific reagent. Try to add a little bit more than you need and dispose of the leftover. Prepare the aliquots inside the workstation (with HEPA filter).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":212,"length":63}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bula0","text":"Cut the parafilm to a size of 1 cm x 5 cm, two or three per Sterivex – sometimes you will need to replace the parafilm in the Sterivex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bduih","text":"Wipe down the benches, centrifuge, and working areas using the PREempt solution/wipes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2er58","text":"Turn on the incubator and set the temperature to 56°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8he2u","text":"Thaw the Sterivex filters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8iv8","text":"Remove the parafilm and remove Longmire’s buffer/SLB using a syringe. You can use a plastic “tripour” to dispose the buffer and then pour all of the volume in the sink. Rinse the tripour with water after use, dry and wipe it down using a paper towel and PREempt solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":169,"length":102}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39h2t","text":"If needed, dry the Sterivex inlet using a Kimwipes (one wipe per Sterivex). Place the Sterivex on a clean Kimwipe while preparing the other one Sterivexes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8nt3i","text":"Add 0.1 mm silica beads (about 0.3 g or three spoons*) into the Sterivex using a weighting paper (make a funnel with the paper to slide in the beads, use one per Sterivex). *It is a white spoon that is stored in the drawer with the silica beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":28},{"style":"italic","offset":174,"length":71}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bdl24","text":"Seal the outlet port of the Sterivex filter unit with the parafilm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5kkop","text":"Inject 720 μL ATL buffer into the Sterivex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ab7l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63fue","text":"One more Sterivex +ATL buffer should be prepared for the extraction blank for detecting contamination during DNA extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f76t9","text":"Place the Sterivex in the vortex adapter and do the “bead-beating” for 10 min to promote cell lysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ufap","text":"Get one 50mL tube per sample, and put the Sterivexes inside the 50mL tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pba9","text":"Incubate the Sterivex at 56°C for 30 min while tilting or rotating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b37mj","text":"Repeat steps 15 and 16 one more time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bop18","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"sqv4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"560FDF49BA7147EFAB17FA4FFDC6B4C1","step_guid":"F0F05D461E1E11EF84A90A58A9FEAC02","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"261c3","text":"Add  80 μL proteinase-K to each Sterivex.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"699jh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ap7ko","text":"Seal the outlet port of the Sterivex filter unit with a parafilm if you notice that some lysate is leaking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"92oj9","text":"Vortex tubes for ~10 s (or simply move it to mix the solution). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"do8sh","text":"Place the Sterivexes back to the 50mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp22m","text":"Incubate tubes at 56°C for 2h while rotating.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds1h6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21pct","text":"While warming the Sterivex filter unit to 56°C, prepare a 2.0 mL tube for DNA recovery (loBind DNA tubes). Note: write the necessary information on the cap of the 2.0 mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":107,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d24b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6o274","text":"After completion of warming, carefully remove the parafilm and the luer fitting on the inlet port of the Sterivex filter unit, while preventing liquid inside from leaking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23bfm","text":"Insert the inlet port of the Sterivex filter unit into the 2.0 mL tube and lightly push it down to the bottom of the 50mL conical tube. Then, close the cap of the conical tube firmly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15c7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7indg","text":"Put the conical tubes in the Megafuge adapters. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dga1r","text":"Centrifuge the conical tube containing the Sterivex filter unit at 6,000 x g for 1min and collect the extracted DNA in a 2 mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aj0sc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h0im","text":"Remove the 50 mL conical tube from the centrifuge and remove the Sterivex filter unit and 2.0 mL tube using tweezers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apk5k","text":"Note: The 2.0 mL tube is uncapped; handle it carefully. Wipe down the tweezers with PREempt wipes between samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4bebn","text":"Discard the used conical tubes (keep one conical tube and use it as a provisory waste container) and Sterivex filter unit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":32,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah5dv","text":"Firmly cap the 2.0 mL tube and proceed with these vials and lysate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqerj","text":"Add 4 μL of RNAseA (100 mg/mL). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9v9d2","text":"Mix pipetting up and down (or vortexing). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dsbsj","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 2 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvn3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"auouk","text":"Add 200 μL buffer AL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"224j8","text":"Mix thoroughly pipetting up and down (or by vortexing). It may form some precipitate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55ndo","text":"Incubate at 56°C for 10 min (it doesn’t need to be in the rotisserie).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbi8q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ok1e","text":"Add 200  μL ethanol (96-100%). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"921t0","text":"Mix thoroughly pipetting up and down (or by vortexing). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14i47","text":"Total volume now is ~1.2 mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tiga","text":"Pipette 600 μL the mixture into a DNeasy mini spin column placed in a 2 mL collection tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cseat","text":"Place the tubes in the centrifuge and spin the tubes at 8,000 rpm (~6,000 x g) for 1 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fn98f","text":"Discard the flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4p2g","text":"Repeat the previous step once more,  using the remaining volume of the lysate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amija","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2v9ss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"39C369B8FB3B48D09731D4C521361FB5","step_guid":"F0F404FA1E1E11EF84A90A58A9FEAC02","title":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6oopj","text":"Place the spin column in a new 2 mL collection tube. If after spinning down you still can see some buffer in the spin column, centrifuge the tube again with a higher speed (about 10,000 x g). If this still not work, spin down with a higher speed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":53,"length":193}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5a6k","text":"Add 500 μL buffer AW1. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7877m","text":"Centrifuge for 1 min at 8,000 rpm (~6,000 x g). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hn1f","text":"Discard the flow through and collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m0io","text":"Place the spin column in a new 2 mL collection tube. Add 500 μL buffer AW2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14vit","text":"Centrifuge for 30 s. at 14,000 rpm (~20,000 x g). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s2mv","text":"Discard the flow through and collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6gt13","text":"Transfer the spin column to a new 1.5 mL or 2 mL microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4o01j","text":"Elute the DNA by adding 200 μL buffer AE to the centre of the spin column membrane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be7ue","text":"Incubate for 1 min. at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b52er","text":"Centrifuge for 1 min at 8,000 rpm (~6,000 x g).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46idb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9735o","text":"OPTIONAL: repeat the step 27 for increased DNA yield.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ctkot","text":"UV for 30 minutes the following:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24hqr","text":"Silica beads - you will need a 5mL tube full of beads to extract DNA from 12 samples ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ihuj","text":"(See bench top guide in the end of this protocol to check the amount of tubes you will need)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":1,"length":90}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bekcv","text":"2mL tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aiq0u","text":"50mL falcon tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6onia","text":"Racks","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"av7d4","text":"Pipettes ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jvsj","text":"pipette tips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"677me","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73ioq","text":"Do not forget to UV tubes for that will be used to aliquot the buffers, and silica beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":90}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION - must be done in Clean Room 1 or Clean Room 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8pcju","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctm0t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4t8eu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rpc5","text":"Materials needed:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8i0v6","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8i27v","text":"0.5 mm glass beads, silica. Molecular grade","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j2b2","text":"Molecular grade ethanol (100%)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek0ss","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3q4ef","text":"The kit Includes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g77m","text":"ATL (lysis buffer)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h2ev","text":"AL (lysis buffer)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a24n6","text":"RNAse","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpj80","text":"AW1 (Wash buffer)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqta9","text":"AW2 (Wash buffer)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq653","text":"AE (Elution buffer)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c54oa","text":"Spin Columns","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccm8q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9gnhu","text":"We are aiming to do about 24 samples per day, but you can aim for less than that until you get comfortable with the protocol.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9gnhu","text":"We are aiming to do about 24 samples per day, but you can aim for less than that until you get comfortable with the protocol.","type":"unstyled"}],"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","entityMap":{},"guid":"4104D1BA341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Proteinase K, 2mL","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"19131","stats":{"total_protocols":13},"url":"","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/","name":"Qiagen"}}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9gnhu","text":"We are aiming to do about 24 samples per day, but you can aim for less than that until you get comfortable with the protocol.","type":"unstyled"}],"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","entityMap":{},"guid":"4104C6D4341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"QIAgen DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit, 50 title: DNA Extraction from 0.22µm Sterivex Filters - Qiagen Blood and Tissue Kit
title_html: DNA Extraction from 0.22µm Sterivex Filters - Qiagen Blood and Tissue Kit

versions.title: DNA Extraction from 0.22µm Sterivex Filters - Qiagen Blood and Tissue Kit
versions.title_html: DNA Extraction from 0.22µm Sterivex Filters - Qiagen Blood and Tissue Kit
